properties.NAME: Etched Into Memory
properties.TITLE: Etched Into Memory
properties.MATERIAL: Fibreglass with a stone finish and brass plates
properties.LOCATION_D:
Waterloo Memorial Recreation Complex - indoors, near the arena steps
101 Father David Bauer Drive
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Etched into Memory is a series of six pieces that, when combined, form a human head. The largest piece is approximately 5 feet high and 6 feet wide and one foot thick. The brass plates each carry different etchings including portrayals of human bodies in

properties.NAME: John Labatt Barley field
properties.TITLE: John Labatt Barley field
properties.LOCATION_D: Labatt Parkette - Park Street at Norman - small parkette near Catalina Homes
properties.DESCRIPTIO: John Labatt Barley Field is a sculpture representing a field of barley. It consists of sixty-one plant forms constructed of hand forged steel stalks and leaves with hammered copper flower heads planted in a landscaped four metre circle.  This site was th

properties.NAME: Looking Outward And Inward
properties.TITLE: Looking Outward And Inward
properties.LOCATION_D: Waterloo Public Library  (Dupont St side) Dupont & Albert
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This sculpture is not a complete narrative. It is ambiguous, exploring the relationship between men and women, but also the male and female within each of us. It can be considered contradictory, a reflection of a psychological state. Hopefully each perso

properties.NAME: Vessel
properties.TITLE: Vessel
properties.LOCATION_D: RIM Park - Sportsplex Entrance
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Carved of granite in various colours, the top of each acorn has a matte, chipped finish, while the bottom portion is polished. Each nest of boulders is further adorned with sandblasted elements - images and words taken from significant historical dates o

properties.NAME: Triad: Dual, Interface And Reunited
properties.TITLE: Triad: Dual, Interface And Reunited
properties.LOCATION_D: Uptown Parkade - Entrance on King St (3 objects) near Willis Way
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Deals with the futility of war.  There are references to bones, armour and helmets in the work. However by suggesting human or vegetative qualities, the artist purposefully introduces hope and regeneration into the detritus of harsh and menacing war time

properties.NAME: Our House
properties.TITLE: Our House
properties.LOCATION_D: Grey Silo Park House -  - adjacent to golf club house
properties.DESCRIPTIO: In conceiving "Our House" the artist is exploring the relationship people have with the land. It can be seen as a sort of allegory - man and nature combining successfully or man protecting nature or an imprisoning nature.

properties.NAME: Laurel Creek
properties.TITLE: Laurel Creek
properties.LOCATION_D: Waterloo City Centre  North side, adjacent to the creek itself
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This piece was inspired by the interrelation of Waterloo and its creeks. The sculpture reflects the water weaving under and through the buildings and landscapes in the city.

properties.NAME: Golden Queen Hybrid
properties.TITLE: Golden Queen Hybrid
properties.LOCATION_D: RIM Park - Martin Farm (across the golf road from the ...)
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This sculpture functions as a marker of the historical importance of the role of agriculture in Waterloo, and serves as a reminder of the previous life of the site.

properties.NAME: The Human Quilt
properties.TITLE: The Human Quilt
properties.LOCATION_D: Waterloo Memorial Recreation Complex - Front Exterior Wall
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Commissioned as a millennium project, the mural reflects the various people of the Waterloo community.

properties.NAME: Prayerflags
properties.TITLE: Prayerflags
properties.LOCATION_D: Rotary Peace Park, RIM Park, adjacent to main building
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Constructed on a steel frame, the sculpture incorporates prayer flags made of 4 different materials, providing different colours.   The sculpture provides a visual focus in the Rotary Park, reinforcing the values of Rotary International.

properties.NAME: Water to Fire
properties.TITLE: Water to Fire
properties.LOCATION_D: Fire Station no 4 - University Ave E

properties.NAME: Choice
properties.TITLE: Choice
properties.LOCATION_D: Father David Bauer Drive  just across the road from the WMRC entrances (4 objects)
properties.DESCRIPTIO: This set of head coverings was created to commemorate and celebrate the City of Waterloo 1857 to 2007.  Designs based on a sunbonnet and three variations of prayer caps symbolize the breadth and impact, the respect, responsibility and legacy of inherited

properties.NAME: (2 sculptures - C2G2)
properties.TITLE: (2 sculptures - C2G2)
properties.LOCATION_D: Canadian Clay & Glass Gallery - Caroline & Erb
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Two Youth projects  not part of our collection but will be included in a walking tour.

properties.NAME: The Waterloo Bell - Bell for Kepler
properties.TITLE: The Waterloo Bell - Bell for Kepler
properties.LOCATION_D: Public Square  Willis Way & King
properties.DESCRIPTIO: A tribute to agricultural traditions, to faith and to knowledge  the Bell represents the balance needed between faith and science in our modern world.  Johannes Kepler succeeded in keeping his faith and his work in science in balance

properties.NAME: Aspiring Orchard
properties.TITLE: Aspiring Orchard
properties.LOCATION_D: 36 Regina Street N at Bridgeport Rd
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Stainless Steel panels have been laser cut to show the shapes of apple trees.  The artist is celebrating the agricultural history of this place, where the Wolfe apple orchard was once located.  Agriculture meets high tech.

properties.NAME: Veterans Memorial
properties.TITLE: Veterans Memorial
properties.LOCATION_D: Scholars Green  University Ave & Hazel St
properties.DESCRIPTIO: A tribute to soldiers who have served and are serving in the Canadian forces.

properties.NAME: Origami Goose
properties.TITLE: Origami Goose
properties.LOCATION_D: Westside Library & YMCA - Fischer-Hallman & Laurelwood
properties.DESCRIPTIO: (TBA with the artist)

properties.NAME: Tree
properties.TITLE: Tree
properties.LOCATION_D: Grey Silo Golf Course (1st fairway)
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The artist has carved images of local fauna into a rare Black Maple tree that was damaged by severe weather.  Rather than losing the tree, the City decided to use it as raw material to tell the story of the local natural inhabitants of that place.

properties.NAME: Rein in the Wind
properties.TITLE: Rein in the Wind
properties.LOCATION_D: RIM Park Premier Sports Fields - entrance feature
